name: $resourceType
desc: Returns the FHIR type name for this instance

name: $identifier
desc: Returns: Identifier(s) by which this encounter is known.

name: $addidentifier
desc: Identifier(s) by which this encounter is known.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Identifier(s) by which this encounter is known.

name: $status
desc: Returns: planned | arrived | triaged | in-progress | onleave | finished | cancelled +.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: planned | arrived | triaged | in-progress | onleave | finished | cancelled +.

name: $statusHistory
desc: Returns: The status history permits the encounter resource to contain the status history without needing to read through the historical versions of the resource, or even have the server store them.

name: $addstatusHistory
desc: The status history permits the encounter resource to contain the status history without needing to read through the historical versions of the resource, or even have the server store them.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: The status history permits the encounter resource to contain the status history without needing to read through the historical versions of the resource, or even have the server store them.

name: $class
desc: Returns: Concepts representing classification of patient encounter such as ambulatory (outpatient), inpatient, emergency, home health or others due to local variations.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Concepts representing classification of patient encounter such as ambulatory (outpatient), inpatient, emergency, home health or others due to local variations.

name: $classHistory
desc: Returns: The class history permits the tracking of the encounters transitions without needing to go  through the resource history.  This would be used for a case where an admission starts of as an emergency encounter, then transitions into an inpatient scenario. Doing this and not restarting a new encounter ensures that any lab/diagnostic results can more easily follow the patient and not require re-processing and not get lost or cancelled during a kind of discharge from emergency to inpatient.

name: $addclassHistory
desc: The class history permits the tracking of the encounters transitions without needing to go  through the resource history.  This would be used for a case where an admission starts of as an emergency encounter, then transitions into an inpatient scenario. Doing this and not restarting a new encounter ensures that any lab/diagnostic results can more easily follow the patient and not require re-processing and not get lost or cancelled during a kind of discharge from emergency to inpatient.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: The class history permits the tracking of the encounters transitions without needing to go  through the resource history.  This would be used for a case where an admission starts of as an emergency encounter, then transitions into an inpatient scenario. D

name: $::type
desc: Returns: Specific type of encounter (e.g. e-mail consultation, surgical day-care, skilled nursing, rehabilitation).

name: $addtype
desc: Specific type of encounter (e.g. e-mail consultation, surgical day-care, skilled nursing, rehabilitation).

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Specific type of encounter (e.g. e-mail consultation, surgical day-care, skilled nursing, rehabilitation).

name: $serviceType
desc: Returns: Broad categorization of the service that is to be provided (e.g. cardiology).

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Broad categorization of the service that is to be provided (e.g. cardiology).

name: $priority
desc: Returns: Indicates the urgency of the encounter.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Indicates the urgency of the encounter.

name: $subject
desc: Returns: The patient or group present at the encounter.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The patient or group present at the encounter.

name: $episodeOfCare
desc: Returns: Where a specific encounter should be classified as a part of a specific episode(s) of care this field should be used. This association can facilitate grouping of related encounters together for a specific purpose, such as government reporting, issue tracking, association via a common problem.  The association is recorded on the encounter as these are typically created after the episode of care and grouped on entry rather than editing the episode of care to append another encounter to it (the episode of care could span years).

name: $addepisodeOfCare
desc: Where a specific encounter should be classified as a part of a specific episode(s) of care this field should be used. This association can facilitate grouping of related encounters together for a specific purpose, such as government reporting, issue tracking, association via a common problem.  The association is recorded on the encounter as these are typically created after the episode of care and grouped on entry rather than editing the episode of care to append another encounter to it (the episode of care could span years).

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Where a specific encounter should be classified as a part of a specific episode(s) of care this field should be used. This association can facilitate grouping of related encounters together for a specific purpose, such as government reporting, issue track

name: $basedOn
desc: Returns: The request this encounter satisfies (e.g. incoming referral or procedure request).

name: $addbasedOn
desc: The request this encounter satisfies (e.g. incoming referral or procedure request).

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: The request this encounter satisfies (e.g. incoming referral or procedure request).

name: $participant
desc: Returns: The list of people responsible for providing the service.

name: $addparticipant
desc: The list of people responsible for providing the service.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: The list of people responsible for providing the service.

name: $appointment
desc: Returns: The appointment that scheduled this encounter.

name: $addappointment
desc: The appointment that scheduled this encounter.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: The appointment that scheduled this encounter.

name: $period
desc: Returns: The start and end time of the encounter.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The start and end time of the encounter.

name: $length
desc: Returns: Quantity of time the encounter lasted. This excludes the time during leaves of absence.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Quantity of time the encounter lasted. This excludes the time during leaves of absence.

name: $reasonCode
desc: Returns: Reason the encounter takes place, expressed as a code. For admissions, this can be used for a coded admission diagnosis.

name: $addreasonCode
desc: Reason the encounter takes place, expressed as a code. For admissions, this can be used for a coded admission diagnosis.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Reason the encounter takes place, expressed as a code. For admissions, this can be used for a coded admission diagnosis.

name: $reasonReference
desc: Returns: Reason the encounter takes place, expressed as a code. For admissions, this can be used for a coded admission diagnosis.

name: $addreasonReference
desc: Reason the encounter takes place, expressed as a code. For admissions, this can be used for a coded admission diagnosis.

lvardefs.name: objRef

name: $diagnosis
desc: Returns: The list of diagnosis relevant to this encounter.

name: $adddiagnosis
desc: The list of diagnosis relevant to this encounter.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: The list of diagnosis relevant to this encounter.

name: $account
desc: Returns: The set of accounts that may be used for billing for this Encounter.

name: $addaccount
desc: The set of accounts that may be used for billing for this Encounter.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: The set of accounts that may be used for billing for this Encounter.

name: $hospitalization
desc: Returns: Details about the admission to a healthcare service.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Details about the admission to a healthcare service.

name: $location
desc: Returns: List of locations where  the patient has been during this encounter.

name: $addlocation
desc: List of locations where  the patient has been during this encounter.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: List of locations where  the patient has been during this encounter.

name: $serviceProvider
desc: Returns: The organization that is primarily responsible for this Encounter's services. This MAY be the same as the organization on the Patient record, however it could be different, such as if the actor performing the services was from an external organization (which may be billed seperately) for an external consultation.  Refer to the example bundle showing an abbreviated set of Encounters for a colonoscopy.

pvardefs.desc: The organization that is primarily responsible for this Encounter's services. This MAY be the same as the organization on the Patient record, however it could be different, such as if the actor performing the services was from an external organization (wh

name: $partOf
desc: Returns: Another Encounter of which this encounter is a part of (administratively or in time).

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Another Encounter of which this encounter is a part of (administratively or in time).
